What is council tax

Council Tax is a property-based tax charged on homes. It helps fund important local services provided by Gloucester City Council, Gloucestershire County Council, and the Police and Crime Commissioner. The amount you pay depends on your property's band and who lives there.

What your council tax pays for

  • Local services from Gloucester City Council (waste collection, street cleaning, parks, leisure facilities)
  • County Council services (adult social care, children's services, schools, highways, libraries)
  • Police and Crime Commissioner for Gloucestershire
  • Parish or Town Council charges (where you live - for example, Quedgeley)

Need help?

If you cannot do something online, you can get help in other ways:

  • Phone: 01452 396396
  • Email: revenues@gloucester.gov.uk (for bill questions) or benefits@gloucester.gov.uk (for Council Tax Support)
  • Visit: Gloucester City Revenues and Benefits, Eastgate Management Suite, Eastgate Street, Gloucester GL1 1PA
